definition: the people one depends upon for one's livelihood/one's bread and butter

sentences.english: Customer is the God of the core foundation of our business.
sentences.chinese: 顧客是我們的衣食父母，是我們事業的核心基礎。
電視是足球的衣食父母。

sentences.english: Remember, that's the hand that feeds you.
sentences.chinese: 記住，那可是你的衣食父母。

sentences.english: In each profession, the customer is God, is operator's Food and Clothing Parents.
sentences.chinese: 在各個行業裏，顧客就是上帝，是經營者的衣食父母。

sentences.english: Wanye, you shouldn't criticize our employer like that.
sentences.chinese: 威因，你可不能這樣批評我們的衣食父母呢。

definition: like a second parent (idiom); one's great benefactor
a benefactor/a person who has significantly helped sb else
lit. not for the monk's sake but for the Buddha's sake (idiom)/fig. (to do sth for sb) out of deference to sb else
pinyin: bu4 kan4 seng1 mian4 kan4 fo2 mian4

definition: to welcome sb with a smiling face (idiom)
to put oneself in sb else's shoes (idiom)
(to play) one's part/one's role/one's duty/(to stay within) one's bounds/dutiful/keeping to one's role
to call to come and shout to go (idiom); to yell orders/always bossing people around
sb with whom one is on familiar terms/sb from the same place (same house, same town etc)/one of us
to bow and bend the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
see 吃水不忘掘井人[chi1 shui3 bu4 wang4 jue2 jing3 ren2]
pinyin: chi1 shui3 bu4 wang4 wa1 jing3 ren2
